answers.answer: Oh I figured it out its another word for preeclampsia . But what will ur Dr do when ur only 21 weeks

My suggestion us to drink a whole lot of water and eat prunes to poop and eat carrots and cucumbers to detoxify,they don't/can't really do anything for it but you need to release the toxins in your body, my mom got it with me then discovered this intestinal movement formula from her chiropractor and took it with her other three and never got it again cuz it kept her toxins out, if you have a naturopathic store around you you can get out there its different from a laxative but if your not comfortable with it anyway then yeah,carrots and cucumbers, lots of then clean yourself out! I mean the docs went do anything, the carrots and cucumbers will, sorry i made that a wee bit confusing
Preeclamsia has to do with pooping?
No but it helps you chances are being constipated and having toxins in your body is partially what gave it to you. they don't know what exactly causes it but i know that this helps.

Really I didn't no that. I have always had trouble pooping since I was young. But lately I have been popping almost every time I go to the bathroom. And yesterday when I was giving my daughter a bath I started seeing black spots. Like  it was raining black stuff in front of my eyes. I have been having  head aches lately. That last all day. And I dont typically get head aches

:/ that *****, pregnancy causes allot of crappy side effects, the number one cause of head aches is dehydration maybe more water would help your supposed to have like two liters a day its what the triage nurse told me

Its more than that.  Its your blood pressure, its protein in your urine, its swelling in your hands, feew, ankles, and face.  depending on how bad it is, dr may advise moderate bedrest  keep your blood pressure down and watch your sodium. Each case is different but i had toxemia when i was pregnant with my first son. Dr cant do too much so its mainly up to you. Good luck!

Yeah I had severe pre-eclampsia and ended up getting fluid on my lungs & had to go to the ER the night I took my son home. During labor they gave me meds through an IV called magnesium sulfate that prevented me from having seizures. It makes you feel really out if it and sick. The worst part for me was after I gave birth I had to be flown to another hospital and they gave me  medicine to get all the fluid off my body. It's definitely a sucky disease to have, but as long as the docs keep a good eye in you, you'll be fine.

question: What is it and what does ur Dr do for it.
title: toxaemia?
